com.jcraft.jsch

Class SftpATTRS

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.jcraft.jsch.SftpATTRS

  • public class SftpATTRS
extends Object
    Attributes of a (remote) file manipulated via Sftp. An SftpATTRS object can contain a variable number of actual attributes. A flags field defines which attributes are present in the structure, and then only these follow.

    This class manages the flags automatically, the setXXX methods also set the corresponding flag.

    When changing attributes using ChannelSftp.setStat(), only these attributes actually contained in the structure are sent to the server and will be changed.

    This class corresponds to the ATTRS structure in the form defined in version 00-02 of the Internet draft SSH File Transfer Protocol, corresponding to version 3 of the SSH File transfer protocol. (Later versions changed the format, and there is no version actually published as RFC.)

    Here is a quote from the specification: 
       uint32   flags
   uint64   size           present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_SIZE
   uint32   uid            present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID
   uint32   gid            present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID
   uint32   permissions    present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_PERMISSIONS
   uint32   atime          present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ACMODTIME
   uint32   mtime          present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ACMODTIME
   uint32   extended_count present only if flag SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_EXTENDED
   string   extended_type
   string   extended_data
     ...      more extended data (extended_type - extended_data pairs),
              so that number of pairs equals extended_count
    See Also:
    ChannelSftp, stat(), lstat(), setStat()

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_ACMODTIME
      Flag indicating the presence of the atime and mtime attributes.
      static int SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_EXTENDED
      Flag indicating the presence of extended attributes.

      Flag indicating the presence of the permissions attribute.

      Flag indicating the presence of the size attribute.
      static int SSH_FILEXFER_ATTR_UIDGID
      Flag indicating the presence of the uid and gid attributes.

      • getSize

        public long getSize()
        Returns the size of the file, in bytes.

      • getUId

        public int getUId()
        returns the numerical user identifier of the owning user.
        The `uid' and `gid' fields contain numeric Unix-like user and group identifiers, respectively.

      • getGId

        public int getGId()
        returns the numerical group identifier of the owning group.
        The `uid' and `gid' fields contain numeric Unix-like user and group identifiers, respectively.

      • getPermissions

        public int getPermissions()
        Returns the Unix permissions of the file.
        The `permissions' field contains a bit mask of file permissions as defined by posix.

      • getATime

        public int getATime()
        returns the last access time.
        The `atime' and `mtime' contain the access and modification times of the files, respectively. They are represented as seconds from Jan 1, 1970 in UTC.

      • getMTime

        public int getMTime()
        returns the last modification time.
        The `atime' and `mtime' contain the access and modification times of the files, respectively. They are represented as seconds from Jan 1, 1970 in UTC.

      • getExtended

        public String[] getExtended()
        returns extended attributes, if any.
        Returns:
        the attributes, in the form of a string array, alternating type identifier and value.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        creates a string representation of this object. This string contains permissions, UID, GID, size and modification time.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
